cip.render.raytrace.material.G

Class Torrance

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.raytrace.material.G.Torrance
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDynXmlObject, IRtG

    public class Torrance
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDynXmlObject, IRtG
    The geometric attenuation function introduced by Torrance and Sparrow as G = min(1, 2(N.H)(N.V)/(L.H), 2(N.H)(N.L)/(V.H)). The original reference is Torrance, K. E. and E. M. Sparrow (1967), "Theory for Off-Specular Reflection from Roughened Surfaces", Journal of the Optical Society of America, vol. 57, no. 9, pp.1105-1114.

    The Torrance-Sparrow geometric attenuation function is specified as a node in an XML file as:

        <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.material.G.Torrance"/>

    Since:
    1.0

      Creates a new instance of Torrance and Sparrow geometric attenuation function.

      • loadFromXml

        public void loadFromXml(@NotNull
                        @NotNull org.w3c.dom.Element xmlElement,
                        @Nullable
                        @Nullable java.util.LinkedList refObjectList)
                 throws DynXmlObjParseException
        Description copied from interface: IDynXmlObject
        Loads this object from an XML DOM Document element. The DynXmlObjLoader has parsed the element and attributes to determine that this is a dynamically loaded object, found and instantiated the class, and is now sending the node to the object so it can initialize itself based on the contents of the node.
        Specified by:
        loadFromXml in interface IDynXmlObject
        Parameters:
        xmlElement - The dynamically loaded object DOM Document element.
        refObjectList - A linked list if named objects (implementing the INamedObject interface) that have already been loaded and can be used to resolve object references.
        Throws:
        DynXmlObjParseException - Thrown if there was an error parsing the object. If this exception is thrown it should be assumed that this object was incorrectly initialized, is invalid, and should not be used in any further operations.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(AngleF aBeta)
        Description copied from interface: IRtG
        Some geometric attenuation functions are initialized from the angle beta that represents the angle between N and H at which slope distribution function drops to half the value of when N = H. Beta is an indicator of surface roughness.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface IRtG
        Parameters:
        aBeta - The angle at which the slope distribution function drops to half its maximum value.

      • evaluate

        public float evaluate(Vector3f N,
                      Vector3f H,
                      Vector3f V,
                      Vector3f L)
        Description copied from interface: IRtG
        Evaluate the geometric attenuation function.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface IRtG
        Parameters:
        N - The surface normal.
        H - The normalized bisector between V and L.
        V - The view or eye vector.
        L - The light vector.
        Returns:
        The value of the geometric attenuation function.
